elements.2211.03304_a0c72dd4eccc5f7419a744b84a749: Traffic safety is important in reducing death and building a harmonious society
elements.2211.03304_09484a0bd7b9f65f04a02828952be: In addition to studies of accident incidences, the perception of driving risk is significant in guiding the implementation of appropriate driving countermeasures
elements.2211.03304_34a068ea57c084a0c95f54dc593e9: Risk assessment can be conducted in real-time for traffic safety due to the rapid development of communication technology and computing capabilities
elements.2211.03304_8222157e2fbe5b184fa3022a25a36: This paper aims at the problems of difficult calibration and inconsistent thresholds in the existing risk assessment methods
elements.2211.03304_233de21339d2106193d1a08f6cde7: It proposes a risk assessment model based on the potential field to quantify the driving risk of vehicles
elements.2211.03304_63cff9a15e44ccd3a1844eca17e35: Firstly, virtual energy is proposed as an attribute considering vehicle sizes and velocity
elements.2211.03304_abee2bde4486ed7e82f7fef1e944f: Secondly, the driving risk surrogate(DRS) is proposed based on potential field theory to describe the risk degree of vehicles
elements.2211.03304_e0077e0ef002911fdbc59b509b257: Risk factors are quantified by establishing submodels, including an interactive vehicle risk surrogate, a restrictions risk surrogate, and a speed risk surrogate
elements.2211.03304_ea1fc829494d0fdfde0aabe85e518: To unify the risk threshold, acceleration for implementation guidance is derived from the risk field strength
elements.2211.03304_e20a7133c041500292266afc22ea5: Finally, a naturalistic driving dataset in Nanjing, China, is selected, and 3063 pairs of following naturalistic trajectories are screened out
elements.2211.03304_f080e4a4bbd663551d698a01a1944: Based on that, the proposed model and other models use for comparisons are calibrated through the improved particle optimization algorithm
elements.2211.03304_76c4fdcf6312b1de0e56f6a6a00dd: Simulations prove that the proposed model performs better than other algorithms in risk perception and response, car-following trajectory, and velocity estimation
elements.2211.03304_e597ff15858d9cf8efbc16ecaca67: In addition, the proposed model exhibits better car-following ability than existing car-following models.
elements.2211.03304_d16a277bec2fd7e15da090459df9d: Road traffic accidents are among the top ten leading causes of death and morbidity globally
elements.2211.03304_7a2d09a902c3d8d765089c6250999: Roughly 1.35 million people die in automobile accidents annually, with 20 to 50 million people suffering non-fatal injuries
elements.2211.03304_17025a9756868b42a1f827f0abab8: Human errors are the primary cause of these traffic accidents
elements.2211.03304_7f66ca2d0d6dcb204f5c80404959f: Risk assessment is of great significance for avoiding human errors, which has great potential to reduce traffic accidents
elements.2211.03304_882aa6d721e74b5f92e691a8d1746: More advanced risk assessment approaches have recently been developed thanks to the fast development of communication technology, computing capabilities, and data gathering technologies
elements.2211.03304_41ca7e6ecb9537f0df00e635be206: Specifically, real-time perception and data transmission between vehicles and intelligent facilities can be achieved through advanced communication technology, which enables information sharing regarding vehiclesâ motion data (e.g., position, speed, and acceleration)
elements.2211.03304_31bd9024836395a5ef8f1f3058099: Based on the real-time updated information, the driving risk of vehicles can be quantified in real-time to guide the operation of appropriate countermeasures
elements.2211.03304_cdd1b4ecbb291602d4fc411447643: Many researchers focused on risk assessment in recent years
elements.2211.03304_8e2c411dd4586d50060c8dedc1ffb: Generally, risk assessment included two types of typical methods, the post-crash stage and the pre-crash stage
elements.2211.03304_89edfa199c9ee462af7237305d1ab: In the post-crash stage, risk assessments of road traffic were generally measured on the basis of statistical accident data
elements.2211.03304_314b3aace8ecaf4433ee4af8eaffe: Knowledge of the variables influencing the incidence of highway crashes can be expanded by taking into account spatial and temporal correlations, according to the review
elements.2211.03304_633722e72cec4a6e2310ae99b6cb0: presented the causes of vehicle accidents on roads using a fault tree model
elements.2211.03304_1ee88a12b78766af10e5c21c78a7e: Meanwhile, road safety indexes, the incidence of highway crashes, and other relative indexes were proposed to evaluate risk levels
elements.2211.03304_58feeef8e084ac952e367e3cbc76a: They were usually obtained from statistical models such as accident regression analyses model
elements.2211.03304_564296dbe348a104c38c34767395b: However, statistical analysis of collision data focused on crash events in the post-crash stage
elements.2211.03304_b3243ca13f4bc92c7d4ec4308df1e: It left out the majority of safe interactions that were common for naturalistic driving and intended to avoid collisions
elements.2211.03304_866a51bb8d495d04c4a7ac932c8f3: Furthermore, slight collisions were generally not included in traffic accident records, and traffic risk analysis methods based on previous accident data had relatively low adaptability and accuracy limitations
elements.2211.03304_4fa7cb87ed896e307e9319418fd3e: It was not enough to only research the crash incidents to guide driving safety
elements.2211.03304_3437613915d5a82a8ca2f1d57825f: To prevent accidents, learning the risk threshold of safe interactions was an indispensable task
elements.2211.03304_8fa990026402c027982b2000c94a7: Pre-crash research intended to figure out the methodology of safe interactions from naturalistic driving data
elements.2211.03304_49b650820f717a7f1ed9776b2b597: In the pre-crash stage, classification was proposed on two aspects: physics-based models and potential field-based theoriesâwhich will be introduced as follows
elements.2211.03304_12a4c470c862f6bb555e75111b6b7: Physics-based models were risk assessment methods based on time or kinematics
elements.2211.03304_28dcc1083d680e7b2e24ed9c4ff79: They were most commonly used in longitudinal analyses, such as the time-to-collision (TTC), the inverse of time-to-collision (TTCi), deceleration rate to avoid a crash (DRAC)
elements.2211.03304_32831136b1a34ad7b3cc24fc276a2: , and lateral analyses, such as the vehicleâs current position (CCP), time-to-lane-cross (TLC), and the variable rumble strip (VRBS)
elements.2211.03304_492bbe58108798aecbd006e7f4b02: However, in real traffic environments, traffic risks were continuous variables that cannot be artificially classified into longitudinal or lateral directions
elements.2211.03304_10e6b5750e39b25ab4d13ea67c04b: compared the performances of different kind of pre-crash risk assessment measures and their discussions showed that the physics-based modeled implement one-dimensional risk assessment and performed poorly in timeliness and robustness, while potential field-based models performed better in robustness and demonstrated a two-dimensional risk assessment but were computationally demanding
elements.2211.03304_a6e9c7dc15cd100f5e58c6b45a6b5: Potential field-based theory for road traffic risk assessments had been widely used in obstacle avoidance and path planning for intelligent vehicles in recent years
elements.2211.03304_670cff5914492ccff2f25bf3c5694: They could represent risks in two or three dimensions because of their advantages in terms of environmental description
elements.2211.03304_665162b0e89042712b4b5410205b4: Some researchers introduced gravity and repulsion into potential field theory
elements.2211.03304_c9b75e8515029daeb9cab74892c63: firstly applied the potential field theory to the perception of the surrounding environment of a robot
elements.2211.03304_11e66d05b27700651f8dc00c81b4a: Gravity was used to indicate the walkable area, and repulsive force indicated the non-walking area
elements.2211.03304_3c2b4975bfbd85bac6c85c5ec99f1: This was mainly used for the path planning decisions of a robot
elements.2211.03304_464a7d06ca31daf8eb16fb2c606eb: introduced the concept of the gravitational field to establish a car-following model based on Krogh's research
elements.2211.03304_ac0318b883c61dd7d166434fbdb32: proposed the field theory of a microscopic traffic model, which was mainly applied to the car-following model
elements.2211.03304_8c7a763d3701d0eb8f33bc9d7315c: He related the vehicle safety forward to a combination of a free fall and repulsive forces brought by surrounding vehicles
elements.2211.03304_bc0d124c881642d134a89e147cc1c: Some researchers applied the electronic field and spring to present the driving risk
elements.2211.03304_68cf90534e5daa0f1d1100a5e12c3: built a vehicle-centered power electronic field combined with the surrounding environment
elements.2211.03304_526d4f45ae3ced917a6a92282c546: However, although the theory was in line with the general scenarios, there were still many realistic scenarios that could not be matched
elements.2211.03304_5e839e492dd86314cad5310a6fcef: combined the electrostatic potential field theory with two-layer fuzzy logic reasoning
elements.2211.03304_351817c350c77260f77eac88be923: The environmental road network was analogized to a resistance network, in which each vehicle generated an electrostatic potential field
elements.2211.03304_b39700ae6bc54df8bd3b1cd1c9a85: The optimal path of the vehicle was planned by the current in the network, thereby realizing the automatic path planning of an intelligent vehicle in a dynamic environment
elements.2211.03304_812aed4ca5f331e33b56f351fee52: combined potential field with elastic order from the field of robotics
elements.2211.03304_8d39dc7253b383eaef003666beba8: The elastic order was used to calculate the minimum path in the potential field to plan a vehicle path and avoid falling into the local optimum
elements.2211.03304_c4c1802daf1ec6efb34c1483014d7: examined an autonomous collision avoidance system based on electric vehicle braking torque
elements.2211.03304_b50dbcc3633694bcd00d8a66223a8: In the system, the braking maneuver intensity was determined using potential field theory, which considered the potential hazards because of occlusions in the intersection
elements.2211.03304_f91e5ccf97c2af72aa879e07b1b0a: proposed a virtual spring model that connected a vehicle and pedestrian to determine the potential field in unsignaled intersections with poor visibility
elements.2211.03304_630c9d57d12db688c42d826d6ecac: The traffic risk was evaluated based on simple physical characteristics, while it involved complex factors
elements.2211.03304_c5b31391d6d1baaf77340e80042ac: constructed a unified Driving Safety Field (DSF) model with an elliptic structure, and the DSF includes a potential field related to road lines, a kinetic field about surrounding vehicles, and a behavior field that was determined by the individual driver characteristics
elements.2211.03304_f17f80c8d32e1cffc2e6e59c94d01: assigned different field functions to different types of obstacles and road structures for path planning
elements.2211.03304_c24c895afa962568d3f824eab8286: Moreover, vehicle collision avoidance was in combination with the planning path and vehicle dynamics constraints
elements.2211.03304_f6a3069629ab6aac64e50721040e6: developed a model based on equivalent force, which calculated the road traffic risk field in different directions
elements.2211.03304_479898109a32d71f156421cbb33f1: proposed a probabilistic risk assessment framework combined with intention identification to detect a threat in advance and apply it to lane-changing scenarios
elements.2211.03304_c120a1321feaf572bf2d6004c27b8: researched a dynamic risk surrogate and conducted its performance in car-following scenarios
elements.2211.03304_e1d68ba247c71ebd309bed8ad7d8e: In all these studies, the road traffic risk was quantified and presented as a distribution in a two-dimensional risk map, in which the potential energy value denoted the road traffic risk level
elements.2211.03304_0508f6b281fe691a06b6c15101efa: Potential field-based theory for road traffic risk assessments intended to serve vehicle decisions
elements.2211.03304_2a059186da12f6052c0c006ed7b03: Usually, vehicles made micro-driving decisions according to assessment results of the risk concerns of their surroundings
elements.2211.03304_4bbc6ab7fb40a0501bd41894707a9: For example, if there was a potential collision in the car-following scenario, the following vehicle would normally change lanes or decelerate as the leading vehicle decelerated to keep safe
elements.2211.03304_8bfeed4e204bdcaa6e750c09ad269: To put it another way, risk assessment directly impacted microscopic vehicle behavior, and the driving risk surrogate reflected this risk status in the form of field strength
elements.2211.03304_45223fcb27cbe4418301d143db8ab: Despite distinct risk models' diverse structures and expressions due to different modeling views, there were no clear differences in assessment mechanisms
elements.2211.03304_25fa08cb1573aeb44cc19ec975b48: These models were based on actual vehicle operation to accurately define microscopic behavior and traffic flow features through model analysis
elements.2211.03304_778a1b9eb8f0f51b4cfc3dc087940: The main distinction lay in the implemented approaches supported by different transportation theories
elements.2211.03304_d91eca0d21eae652ac854628b32b7: The potential field theories integrated varied traffic factors, which led to a challenging calibration process
elements.2211.03304_655b8506ba0759700f3e403057cf0: Among these factors, vehicles' masses were normally designed as different constants in existing potential field theories
elements.2211.03304_8ad8cf405a03fa359a71182d6e163: Thus, the virtual mass used to be calibrated offline and processed ideally
elements.2211.03304_87506853defad42e3f74aaed56c09: However, vehicles were heterogeneous in naturalistic driving environments
elements.2211.03304_ce24e0456527092cadf046076b97e: The masses of vehicles were different from each other even for the same type of vehicles
elements.2211.03304_5dcf9776c94d0db20b9862dc3ff37: Furthermore, the masses of vehicles could not be exhaustive precisely
elements.2211.03304_3331a54ba4fe52ac08783675bceff: The ubiquitous cameras and radars roadside hardly perceived the mass, although they could collect a lot of vehicle status information
elements.2211.03304_6e2dfc4896570aa73666e39f18ea3: Moreover, the risk thresholds of field energy were not unified in different scenarios
elements.2211.03304_6aaaddc653b9bb94f2444ce0e811c: The thresholds were fixed in the related interactions scenario
elements.2211.03304_90a0d1aa6bbfebe61d5c1b464de55: The threshold needed to change when the interaction was transferred to another type
elements.2211.03304_f1284652bf2a28c3f51eb7a1e9e3f: That meant effective risk assessment depended on enumeration and identification of interaction scenarios
elements.2211.03304_b29bece28e9ed8a06395ec28f7e63: However, there were tens of thousands of interactive scenes
elements.2211.03304_94cfb21d909b3530b3354feb21e8f: And it was difficult to recognize scenario type accurately in a very short time
elements.2211.03304_7a224fe556bb99631dad365e3230c: To fill the research gaps, this paper develops an innovative driving risk surrogate(DRS) to solve challenging calibrations and inconsistent threshold problems
elements.2211.03304_79a0b3d21594fa1a7251676e38ded: In the modeling process of DRS, we consider sizes as the critical vehicle attribute, while that was mass in the previous models
elements.2211.03304_2a7579bfc9b367dfa2ee372614777: Vehicle sizes are more intuitive and more accessible to obtain than mass through real-time perception
elements.2211.03304_ee8f4a6eeef05161138b52cf12ff5: The specific size information enables the parameters of the virtual energy of heterogeneous vehicles to be trained and calibrated by the real driving dataset
elements.2211.03304_161bcadebe880345f7446126691e9: A relationship between field energy and acceleration is proposed for the problem of inconsistent thresholds
elements.2211.03304_49f605fdf74ee84f026de125fd4ef: The acceleration is used to calibrate parameters in different scenarios according to naturalistic driving data
elements.2211.03304_543f4c42fab4fb2e96d4f1631bdf2: Also, we propose a speed risk surrogate to demonstrate the driver's pursuit of efficiency
elements.2211.03304_08bab68fb524adfe1e43f007845b7: The proposed DRS accurately characterizes the driving risk level and explains varied microscopic driving behaviors
elements.2211.03304_114b27a0698c778fbd7b06fbf8c19: The value of DRS directly impacts vehicle behavior at the microscopic level
elements.2211.03304_08c7bd1858c8fce3c51be213d4e08: Since driving safety circumstances affect how a driver executes their next action, microscopic behaviors can be guided by the risk strength of DRS
elements.2211.03304_b1cb3dff99b843ec5327814308ab2: Based on the model establishment, DRS is applied to the car-following model
elements.2211.03304_041b2db66ee401570b4953ddcc52a: Results show that DRS can successfully present the rules of microscopic car-following behavior and perform well in trajectory estimation
elements.2211.03304_070336a94bcf0753664276a3e931f: The main contributions of this paper to the literature are threefold: 1
elements.2211.03304_b7080707a286e82bd86aecfaaa626: The driving risk assessment issue is tackled from a new perspective: an integrated model is developed by interactive vehicle risk, restrictions risk, and speed risk. 2
elements.2211.03304_01ef87e40b80eba9784ca8d792e2b: The attribution of vehicles, virtual energy, is introduced based on size and velocity
elements.2211.03304_276ae683bd1757280c8d1016c8ee9: It makes DRS more in line with the risk varying in drivers' perception and solves the problem of idealized processing mass in conventional models. 3
elements.2211.03304_9b4856045247fdd9917a1cca23827: Acceleration is designed as the output of DRS, solving the problem of difficult calibration and inconsistent thresholds
elements.2211.03304_19995e3307ef7dfc78b005eb4fd58: It is derived to motion status, and DRS is applied to simulate car-following behavior successfully
elements.2211.03304_4f908b0cc7e9682fa04dd5c8e6e65: The rest of the paper is organized as follows
elements.2211.03304_80a667411d1ecb6bbf0f8c2da7c56: Section 2 establishes DRS, and acceleration is deduced from the risk field strength to prepare for trajectory estimation
elements.2211.03304_0adc9dd1637886b1ee8e6b5da99a9: Section 3 introduces the naturalistic driving dataset, data pre-processing, and parameter calibration
elements.2211.03304_0e24b8772f1105ec6628816510ec7: In section 4, we present the risk response performance of four different models, including the proposed model
elements.2211.03304_c23c8a6a78c3d59fd156ff88159f1: Simulations of trajectory estimation are conducted, and the results are analyzed and discussed
elements.2211.03304_9a63f5bf28835a2dd6e7e1d6746ce: Finally, we conclude the paper in Section 5 with recommended future research.
elements.2211.03304_aa3cea4c294e75124fcd58d9e27f9: The safety of a driving vehicle is influenced by its surroundings
elements.2211.03304_adc9f9ec4cdd6299489e12d9408e9: Thus, it is necessary to analyze surroundings and classify them into different categories for risk modeling
elements.2211.03304_a32e834b15e76e350a946d92baf2a: In subsection 2.1, the factors are divided into three categories, including interactive vehicle risk, restriction objects risk, and desired speed risk
elements.2211.03304_394f430a9d53491c49038ee7736f7: Vehicle attribute is designed in subsection 2.2 for representing important characteristics of each vehicle
elements.2211.03304_48919b92f2dd6d9eefcc90d2820bd: For example, the risk formed by vehicles with different types is obviously different from each other even in the same motion state, driving scenario, and desired speed
elements.2211.03304_44d61d3d1397b1496473557db6952: In the following three subsections, the three types of risk surrogates are analyzed and proposed for the DRS modeling.
elements.2211.03304_1be9c217f4d513b2c31e801548c73: Some studies indicated that the majority of road and traffic elements have a significant impact on driving behavior
elements.2211.03304_106bc57a4c932e7cbd04524607f82: Human driver factors affecting driving risk can be divided into four categories: physiological-psychological factors, cognitive level, driving skills, and violations
elements.2211.03304_72ff7e0ded0b0539a40029eda1aa6: Drivers will adopt a variety of driving behaviors to preserve their own safety
elements.2211.03304_d9c64527a242987657f6ddd2fbe14: In general, a vehicle's goal, regardless of the scenarios, is to reach its desired speed while maintaining a safe clearance between itself and other vehicles
elements.2211.03304_fd2366c39058c5d218fa4d87fc1d0: Specifically, the factors affect driving safety, such as human driver, subject vehicleâs performance status, other road users, surrounding vehiclesâ movement status, obstacles, traffic rules, and road alignment
elements.2211.03304_e1546bab22bfc103241b587be8b81: Equipment failure, such as tire blowout, or brake failure, can affect vehicle performance status
elements.2211.03304_9c7ceb57b61adf1494d0ee21e615e: This paper assumes that the performance status of the driver and the vehicle is at a normal level
elements.2211.03304_8d5e51ada156a7c6e46d0cdc3bd80: Each driver with mental health and driving in well performance vehicle would try to avoid crashes and reach higher efficiency in expressways
elements.2211.03304_994cb6685bc840ef1d8ab969a00f0: In urban road scenes, vehicles during driving will interact with other road users, such as pedestrians and non-motor vehicles, and they will also impact driving safety
elements.2211.03304_9aa8e4d8bff3c17e2b4f2fc846868: However, those road users do not appear on the expressway
elements.2211.03304_7932c738e04db5b23face5b8c176c: As mentioned above, driving safety is also related to surrounding vehiclesâ motion status, road environment, traffic rules, and road alignment
elements.2211.03304_e2e0c59bead6897935669dab3d647: Undoubtedly, a driving vehicle interact and avoid conflict with other vehicles around it
elements.2211.03304_747394a6be613552c474a950eda9f: And then, road environment refers to the static obstacles on or on both sides of the road
elements.2211.03304_12d6634a952c7e85a39d386869dbe: The drivers must avoid hitting these objects
elements.2211.03304_2cb7b52e7e887d0b06006922180a7: Common objects of this kind include the isolation belt in the center of the road, the anti-collision pier at the edge of the road, the area of road construction, etc
elements.2211.03304_dbd047e12e17044850851aa47b441: Road markings and road signs define traffic rules for vehicle driving
elements.2211.03304_3d2f433e3e0111a3380955aa43b3f: The rich traffic rules related to driving safety are filtered out and are shown in
elements.2211.03304_57cb8f0b0c9052fc7b40090680cb5: The road alignment also belongs to restricted access because of the same characteristic.
elements.2211.03304_27c1911f8da6d5fc23ebfbb6d2b0f: As a result, DRS can be separated into three categories: interactive vehicle risk surrogate, restrictions risk surrogate, and speed risk surrogate, which are described by
elements.2211.03304_c47af14de820ad8a1f363589f8152: They are field functions and act as field vectors from different risk sources
elements.2211.03304_e4635dc59bbd7d0d263a4fecfba82: Due to varied directions of field vectors, there are phenomena in which the field vectors cancel others
elements.2211.03304_af605e4e3b84c1c749065b3387d1b: However, for road safety, such phenomena are not consistent with reality
elements.2211.03304_0a4ab385d077f4736d12b5009440c: After superimposing diverse driving risk field vectors, the driving risk will normally grow rather than decrease
elements.2211.03304_859624cb76db2c4b414677dcd4478: As a result, the total of the field strength modes created by distinct risk surrogates is used to describe the degree of the driving risk of a subject vehicle
elements.2211.03304_404ef1fc2bffdb822e31f030434af: Thus, the total risk field strength of DRS can be expressed as

elements.2211.03304_e5c6188f893087b65f6cc87940ea8: is the interactive vehicle risk field strength which is the risk of
elements.2211.03304_e101ca12ea43463aa1e5b864391e6: is the restrictions risk field strength and represents the risk of
elements.2211.03304_3152e1d4b056c93ecc46c8fb6df7a: suffered from physical limitation or road rule
elements.2211.03304_1da58f015dffd9324af5a736e9c1d: is the speed risk field strength of

elements.2211.03304_37c6cd040283a660c1443e54e8178: Driving features, including the vehicles layer and the environment layer, are input
elements.2211.03304_c0a3b86b95aa83bdeb36d012b1c68: The vehicle's layer comprises the ID, position, velocity, acceleration, width, and length of the subject vehicle and its neighboring vehicles
elements.2211.03304_5261a2ebb6f326d9b64d6c98728bd: For privacy, vehicles are numbered with ID instead of license plates
elements.2211.03304_c1281295562b20549e8275b244301: The environment layer is composed of road layout and traffic rules
elements.2211.03304_5ad1b6d89d71d5aadda64f8413a84: And then, the DRS model consists of the interactive vehicle risk surrogate, the restrictions risk surrogate, and the speed risk surrogate and outputs the result of the risk assessment and acceleration plan
elements.2211.03304_66b78b1ba075b5045b2dc0730b871: The trajectories containing speed and location can already be inferred based on the acceleration.
elements.2211.03304_a3716e8798b61e920502f5e3a7e7d: , the mass and type of a vehicle are the characteristics of the vehicle attributes
elements.2211.03304_ed93f12cae8e72c1559175763da8d: However, it does not match reality in some scenarios
elements.2211.03304_ea434f560c24be4121ecb84b4a2e6: For example, a truck with 200 tons presents a 200 times higher risk than a vehicle with two tons
elements.2211.03304_113aa1a4686ecec854b711bc75133: This may not be intuitive enough
elements.2211.03304_a9e60af6e730faccce3f61eeb8e3f: In particular, it is impractical that safety clearance between trucks with 200 tons requires 200 times as much space as automobiles with two tons
elements.2211.03304_bd29fae7bdb78e4840ee125d34db1: Drivers usually do not accurately perceive the mass of the interacting vehicle during driving
elements.2211.03304_26dbea9b0b462ad77c5d7ff297ffc: The most sensitive thing for drivers is the sizes of the interacting vehicles, including length, width, and height
elements.2211.03304_eba27eb6c3d06813095bccde9105e: Therefore, the sizes are selected to replace the mass and type and become an important attribute, which has been more in line with the actual effect
elements.2211.03304_9ad183f041c2cabd5716c4d4bb8ab: However, obtaining the vehicle's height information from the real driving dataset is difficult
elements.2211.03304_fb766d4cf7329361ac016a9a5050f: According to vehicle types in the market, it can be found that a vehicle's height is related to its length and width (e.g., in general, the height of trucks is greater than that of SUVs (sport utility vehicles)
elements.2211.03304_42c44b341119b354be25a38e11011: The height of SUVs is usually greater than that of vehicles, which is similar to sizes of them)

elements.2211.03304_eb2bd067cdf5403caa07034750703: As mentioned in subsection 2.1, the restrictions risk surrogate characterizes the physical field of the impact of impassable areas on driving safety
elements.2211.03304_1494c08b473ff03a69d3dec111001: The attributes of restriction mainly determine the field strength and vector direction of the restrictions risk surrogate
elements.2211.03304_9cb3cbebca45f54b3fb7ecde90182: Restrictions forming the risk surrogate can be divided into two categories. 1
elements.2211.03304_3916579e1be277ac693b801af9458: Stationary objects that could substantially collide with vehicles and cause losses (personal and property), such as isolation, anti-collision pier, and construction sign
elements.2211.03304_ac4e6d0f6ce723525a484be8cf22e: The closer the vehicle is to this type of stationary object, the more likely it is to collide with it
elements.2211.03304_254948d2b18d974b166b027c2efb1: Moreover, as the vehicle approaches, this possibility and the risk of collisions do not increase linearly since as the clearance decreases, the driving risk increases faster
elements.2211.03304_1a28f94f39d3c45efa13772fe9a49: Meanwhile, as the vehicle approaches this kind of stationary object, the variation law of the degree of driving risk posed by this kind of stationary object is the same no matter from any direction. 2
elements.2211.03304_f51204163ac061830f9bfcb64309b: Static objects constrain the behavior of the subject vehicle, such as lane lines, road signs, etc
elements.2211.03304_5e54e491306b9da4b8ce3ba2ab3ae: For this category of restrictions, the violation of the restrictions generated by the vehicle will not lead to a substantial collision accident
elements.2211.03304_5348d98245ad4e84f0a05ff299e1e: However, it will result in a violation of laws or traffic regulations
elements.2211.03304_8be8c53591d92b9c2651fbae8685e: The driving risk caused by such violations is determined by the traffic regulations they violate
elements.2211.03304_6117173b192f23a9d6524cc08626b: For example, China's traffic regulations stipulate that: vehicles are prohibited from crossing the solid white line, changing lanes, or driving on the line
elements.2211.03304_ad7e242bc396d5c28c10310253a5c: If a driver finds himself deviating from his current lane, the driver perceives a risk of violating the lane line
elements.2211.03304_6cc06798eae58c1d07e205009d182: This risk drives the vehicle back toward the centerline
elements.2211.03304_2b54c07e22f12545624caa5e9e53f: In addition, the closer the vehicle is to the lane line, the greater the driving risk

elements.2211.03304_27bee7278c03c57f7c9b888b4cacf: Model calibration is a necessary process to concretize the undetermined parameters
elements.2211.03304_2b3a624a3a57ed79f5120e1da2945: The parameter calibration process is completed based on meta-heuristic algorithms and a naturalistic driving dataset
elements.2211.03304_77fb975f038c97ba7993f4c2f3d0b: We define many undetermined parameters in section 2 and those parameters are of great value for the proposed model
elements.2211.03304_1a336518b8401c048ac28c29b7c1b: In this section, we intend to select driving data and concretize those parameters effectively to improve the model's applicability and prevent its distortion.
elements.2211.03304_ed4ff88e00b4a32b75e7f988d128c: Safe interactions generally happen in naturalistic driving behavior
elements.2211.03304_7893ed8a5327ae7a2c4da379cd97c: Although human drivers cannot obtain the specific movement information of surrounding vehicles, the human driver has the most sophisticated task processor in the world and can sensitively perceive the driving risks of the surrounding environment
elements.2211.03304_526142b3ab97964de2ada5cfed881: Especially when the speed of the front vehicle changes obviously, the following manual-driven vehicle as the rear vehicle will change the speed accordingly
elements.2211.03304_04209caf3a699d4bb4f1e072d4dee: Therefore, the real driving trajectory dataset can be used as the research dataset of this paper and be adopted to calibrate the proposed model
elements.2211.03304_9e9bcbf3304a3d133baf88f7197ba: In order to model DRS more in line with Chinese human driving habits, this paper chooses a dataset of naturalistic driving from Ubiquitous Traffic Eyes
elements.2211.03304_567064733c99646811b026ebd05ac: in Nanjing City, China, to study the model performance
elements.2211.03304_882a6a7b479995355db94ff381fa5: The dataset contains pure trajectory data, which applies to micro-driving behavior studies
elements.2211.03304_eb185ba162c40066c0332ececbe2f: According to the purpose of this study, we select the trajectory data on a segment of an urban highway that is one of the busiest interchange hubs in the south of Nanjing city, China, as shown in
elements.2211.03304_cae9da21ac6fab8ab002b9088e1a0: A large number of naturalistic driving activities occur in this area
elements.2211.03304_b8fb5575be1195c757a4ab6c50643: The length of the road section is 352 meters, east-west direction
elements.2211.03304_c8905f5d6b5ddb098b9de13809db4: The dataset is captured by unmanned aerial vehicles at 285m and provid the precise vehicle position coordinates with a time accuracy of 0.1s
elements.2211.03304_3ce26749346f1797a73af0b2294f4: The detailed data of each vehicle in 1184 seconds are contained, including vehicle ID, position, speed, acceleration, width, length, and time stamp.
elements.2211.03304_930e04be143bf97ab052b48081835: Before using the dataset for our study, it is necessary to pre-process the original data
elements.2211.03304_1fab133b00a867e97beb2f1603c43: First, all data at the same time are taken out
elements.2211.03304_75969d3089b0399e42a3d30872efd: They are grouped according to lane lines and then sort by X-axis coordinates within each lane to realize the judgment of the leading and following vehicles
elements.2211.03304_8d18f2db41287e1ab759e998b32c6: The track pairs are searched according to vehicle IDs
elements.2211.03304_c90e0bbfc763a8c75e7efe68f5ca2: Finally, we filter out the track segments where the lane-changing behavior occurs less than 0.5s
elements.2211.03304_7774f526c05c236bd66d2ae1f1bb9: Based on the data pre-processing, 3063 pairs of car-following trajectories are obtained for further verification.
elements.2211.03304_efcd5cdbde6b201484cb63e304738: Parameter calibration is a bridge from the theoretical level to the practical application level
elements.2211.03304_07bb74a9dd266f0144bb6bde8d907: An effective parameter calibration process can enhance the model's applicability and avoid distortion

elements.2211.03304_83a5b24101e9034365458e0eda402: Interactive vehicle risk, restrictions risk, and speed risk are proposed and integrated into DRS
elements.2211.03304_090d0353cb65971e76046c1364e4f: Instead of IDM and DRPFM considering velocity from one side, DRS study velocity influence more comprehensively in three aspects
elements.2211.03304_aa92efee9b32178052582f6672cc3: Based on studying the front vehicle velocity in the vehicle energy, interactive vehicle risk surrogate, and speed risk surrogate, DRS shows the mechanism of the influence of the front vehicle speed on the risk perception and driving efficiency of the rear vehicle to a certain extent and makes a significant contribution to the research of the risk assessment model
elements.2211.03304_914404c5bd8fbca6187a90ffc6365: In addition, in traditional methods, IDM does not consider the impact of vehicle attributes
elements.2211.03304_52d4c2fbf28bb521a7dc9d9805a95: The virtual mass of the vehicle is considered in DRPFM
elements.2211.03304_8cc036b0cc01d785f5e9590f1d13e: However, in the general naturalistic driving data, it is difficult to obtain the vehicle quality data
elements.2211.03304_afa92c6ae44fcbea1122307e86202: Therefore, the consideration of vehicle mass in models based on virtual mass is ideal and not enough to support practical applications
elements.2211.03304_4dcbcc8af6e582d4dab60986d36d7: Although the driver in the rear vehicle cannot acquire the specific value of the quality of the front vehicle, he can intuitively gain the shape of the front vehicle
elements.2211.03304_4f790d9e2f37e3a514bd7100813ae: This paper select the naturalistic driving dataset from the aerial photography perspective
elements.2211.03304_2d7bb352d35f303be0665115d06c5: Vehicle sizes provide a realistic basis for the calibration of the virtual energy of DRS
elements.2211.03304_2dea5dc3e65bfb17d506112f00df1: Finally, it is worth discovering that the model proposed in this paper is calibrated by real data, while errors between simulation results and real trajectories still exist
elements.2211.03304_af3efb6c6b01c578b666805509558: But we found that DRS simulations perform better trajectory behavior than manual driving to some extent
elements.2211.03304_ab8e0744ebaf5441a8fc8f0c6fa3c: In terms of space headway, when the vehicle in front starts decelerating, DRS usually maintains a larger space headway distance than manual driving vehicles to ensure more safety
elements.2211.03304_e371ee884ec9eccce8f3960049e5d: In terms of velocity and acceleration, DRS always reacts to changes in the preceding vehicle earlier than human-driven vehicles
elements.2211.03304_64d29c1c56329721b04052c4b77d1: In addition, velocity fluctuations of DRS are generally smaller than that of manual driving, as shown in
elements.2211.03304_b347bdb99ac055849adceac64708a: That avoid unnecessary acceleration and deceleration and save fuel partly
elements.2211.03304_492c5ad89e1edfb16d16ee4cf16f9: Based on the above performances, DRS effectively captures the human perception of risk and the driving rules in the car-following case
elements.2211.03304_2fb1b11eaf7e602279a6410692aa0: Thus, it has the potential to provide solutions for planning driving trajectories and reduce the driving instability caused by human reaction time, driving operation level, and individual driving style.
elements.2211.03304_715e5370fa6d6d83de8da47c04e9c: In this study, DRS is proposed to reflect risks during safe interactions in driving
elements.2211.03304_b27202de98c7a05c72b5a53024eab: In comparison with existing driving risk potential models, the proposed model introduces virtual energy and speed risks into the model for the first time
elements.2211.03304_812d440e5bd4ed683c94a5a05ee74: The driving risk assessment issue is tackled from a new perspective that is an integrated model consisting of interactive vehicle risk, restrictions risk, and speed risk
elements.2211.03304_454254a2a1b46ad76cb5c91599618: DRS reflects the driving risk distribution of vehicles at different relative speeds and different following clearances and describes the general phenomenon more naturally
elements.2211.03304_99f3d68568bc6118fb6cdbd1a8883: DRS model is applied to the car-following process
elements.2211.03304_351f72baf75a7ebc8bed443258abd: Through the calibration based on the naturalistic driving dataset, the car-following motion at the micro-level of the vehicle is simulated
elements.2211.03304_c32e69320d0a8b2b8ad19b26dec69: The proposed model performs well in trajectory estimation, space headway estimation, and velocity estimation and even has better driving behaviors than the manual driving vehicle
elements.2211.03304_4cebb94f0f9b0a97748492ca50620: Safe interaction in driving is always a core issue
elements.2211.03304_bb8bacc4f4051284fb3d1217338c6: The proposed DRS has the potential to be applied to guide the operation of appropriate countermeasures in intelligent transportation systems, connected and automated vehicle environments, or intelligent assistance systems
elements.2211.03304_36a071390afd8ee4e4072df471390: The academic significance of this paper includes two parts: one is the modeling of driving risk, and the other is the modeling of car-following
elements.2211.03304_4382c712757ed81e708b1a3332cea: DRS proposed in this paper greatly improves the traditional risk potential field model
elements.2211.03304_32dfc3bd4a45d5cfe2527001a4e2b: The designed virtual energy is more in line with the driver's intuitive feeling of interactive vehicles
elements.2211.03304_d38762243a22ecc0c174c1513092a: Meanwhile, it also solves the problem that the vehicle quality cannot be obtained from naturalistic driving datasets of aerial photography, which leads to the idealized processing of virtual quality in conventional models
elements.2211.03304_a0d58baa259a5d8ef184c5ecbdaf6: The virtual energy and speed risk surrogate considers the front vehicle speed and the influence mechanism of the front vehicle speed on risk perception
elements.2211.03304_34c63451867442d599abe44c302b1: It presents the driving efficiency of the subject vehicle
elements.2211.03304_ce570e5ee60154293fbf6a89d672a: This enables the proposed model to respond to the velocity variation earlier and provide a more comfortable and efficient trajectory service
elements.2211.03304_9bdfc1fdaf900603b63cdd88fe47a: In addition, based on the risk field strength, acceleration that can guide the vehicle's motion is outputted
elements.2211.03304_c3ceb69fe2d441c492400bd7bce30: On the one hand, acceleration is utilized to solve the problem that the threshold is not unified in different traffic scenarios
elements.2211.03304_5496107fc0b42bd661596ca509dad: The risk surrogate model can be calibrated automatically based on acceleration according to the real driving dataset
elements.2211.03304_01db738967ddafe5853e52df64da0: This also simplifies the complexity of the calibration of the field strength threshold
elements.2211.03304_684a557ce884db27995d9a383bbc5: On the other hand, the output acceleration realizes the modeling of car-following behavior and can be derived from the modeling of lane-changing behavior
elements.2211.03304_966a543a7e21bfbc7212ce7728673: A new foundation can be laid for the risk distribution in traffic flow through the connection between the microscopic model and the macroscopic model of traffic flow
elements.2211.03304_4708d4503e09c20e738de1aabddd7: This study reveals a great potential for applying the proposed algorithm
elements.2211.03304_f8f91d5d686c7eb34ceaa689a9d08: However, this study has some limitations which need to be further improved
elements.2211.03304_1ee5874c16af98e1ecb917d20e672: First, there is a lack of research on different driving styles
elements.2211.03304_36b86c9957f40c317661c49dcaf65: The parameters of the proposed model are calibrated based on the minimum error of the naturalistic driving dataset
elements.2211.03304_6503038950bde12c5587050c3b602: It is expected that further research will be conducted on datasets with driver characteristics
elements.2211.03304_7b9b3306fd8348969f98798c1da9a: The corresponding parameters of specific categories of drivers will be calibrated
elements.2211.03304_0e33c7073d2462b0a80b3e01b4a6a: This will enhance the anthropomorphic performance of the proposed model
elements.2211.03304_ee68c52d8f7bfa276e24e43970088: Secondly, the traffic elements considered in this paper are relatively simple and have not been verified on urban roads
elements.2211.03304_3c9b7a735272de1c2f142e637b75e: In further research, we will calibrate parameters in new scenarios and verify the car-following performance in more complex traffic scenarios
elements.2211.03304_0f95cf57d8a563699ee26e597af71: Nonetheless, we believe that the application of DRS and car-following in this paper may open a new perspective for many tasks to advance the development of micro-behavioral models and traffic flow models.
